alert.note: Alert for Clay; Coosa; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:51AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Talladega, northeastern Coosa and southwestern Clay Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 150 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oak Grove, or near Sylacauga, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Childersburg, Goodwater, Talladega Springs, Stewartville, Oak Grove, Bon Air, Fayetteville, Sycamore, Parkdale, Sylacauga Municipal Airport, Overbrook, Gantts Quarry, Hollins, Varnons, Roselle and Mignon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
